entry.title: What does โwinningโ mean in Karabakh?

media:group.media:title: What does โwinningโ mean in Karabakh?
media:group.media:description:
Gaรฏdz Minassian, a journalist at Le Monde in France, a scholar, and a political analyst joins CivilNet to discuss how Armenian journalists can and should cover the Karabakh conflict ethically and effectively, as well as how the perception of some western media outlets regarding their partiality impacts what voices are heard.
Minassian is also the author of a 2020 book entitled, โCan you still win a war?โ In the interview, Minassian discusses what โwinningโ a war means today, and how he sees victory in the context of the Karabakh conflict.

media:group.media:description:
๐ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีซ ีพีกึีนีกีบีฅีฟ ีีซีฏีธีฌ ีีกีทีซีถีตีกีถีถ ีกีตีฝ ีทีกีขีกีฉีพีก ีซึ ีกีฝีธึีฌีซีฝีธีพ ีขีธีฌีธึีซีถ ีซึีกึ ีญีกีผีถีฅึ ิฑึึีกีญีธึีดึ ีีกีตีซีฝีซ 22-ีซ ีกีฝีธึีฌีซีฝีซีถ ีถีก ีกีฝีกึ, ีธึ ิฑีคึีขีฅีปีกีถีซ 86 600 ึีกีผีกีฏีธึีฝีซ ีฏีซีฌีธีดีฅีฟึีจ, ีธึีถ ีซีถึีจ ีณีกีถีกีนีธึีด ีง ีธึีบีฅีฝ ีฟีกึีกีฎึีกีตีซีถ ีกีดีขีธีฒีปีกีฏีกีถีธึีฉีตีธึีถ, ีถีฅึีกีผีธึีด ีง ีถีกึ ิผีฅีผีถีกีตีซีถ ีีกึีกีขีกีฒีจึ ิฑึึีกีญีซ ิฑีฆีฃีกีตีซีถ ีชีธีฒีธีพีจ, ิฑึึีกีญีซ ีฃีธึีฎีธีฒ ึ ีถีกีญีฏีซีถ ีถีกีญีกีฃีกีฐีถีฅึีจ ีบีกีฟีกีฝีญีกีถีฅึีซีถ ีีกีทีซีถีตีกีถีซีถึ ีีกีตีกีฝีฟีกีถีซ ีฅึีฏึีธึีค ีถีกีญีกีฃีกีฐ ีีธีขีฅึีฟ ีีธีนีกึีตีกีถีถ ีงีฌ ิฑึึีกีญีซ ีญีธึีฐึีคีกึีกีถีกีฏีกีถ ีดีฅีฎีกีดีกีฝีถีธึีฉีตีกีถีจ ีฐีกึึึีฅึี ยซีคีธึึ ีกีตีคึีกีถ ีถีกีซีีพ ีฅึยปึ ๐ีิฒ ีถีกีญีฏีซีถ ีฐึีกีดีกีถีกีฟีกึ ีีกีดีพีฅีฌ ิฒีกีขีกีตีกีถีถ ีกีดึีธึีฅึ ีฟีกีฝีถึ ึีตีก ึีกีฒีกึีกีฏีกีถ ีญีธึีฐึีคีกีฏึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีถีฅึีจึ ๐ีีกีญีกีฃีกีฐ ิฑึีกีตีซีฏ ีีกึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีตีกีถีจ ีกึีฃีฅีฌีฅึ ีฐีกีถึีกีฐีกีพีกึีถีฅึีถ ีธึ ีฝีกีฐีดีกีถีกึีกีฏีฅึ ีฏีกึีฎีซึีซ ีกึีฟีกีฐีกีตีฟีดีกีถ ีกีฆีกีฟีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจึ ๐ีีธึีขีฅีถ ีีกึีคีกีถีตีกีถีซ ีจีถีฟีกีถีซึีจ ิฑึึีกีญีธึีด ีฏีถีฅึีคีถีซ 20 ีดีซีฌีซีกึีค ีคึีกีด:

entry.title: Despite lack of progress, Kremlin says Armenia, Azerbaijan close to peace deal

media:group.media:title: Despite lack of progress, Kremlin says Armenia, Azerbaijan close to peace deal
media:group.media:description:
The latest round of peace talks between Armenia and Azerbaijan ended in Moscow Thursday after just 20 minutes without any apparent progress made to resolve the countriesโ decades-long conflict. In the end, Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan, Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev, and Russian President Vladimir Putin didnโt sign an agreements, though Pashinyanโs office confirmed the three countriesโ deputy prime ministers would meet next week to โcontinue workโ on resolving transport matters. Despite this, Kremlin spokesperson Dimitry Peskov told reporters today that there is still a possibility that a peace treaty will be signed soon.

media:group.media:description:
As Turkeyโs presidential election heads to a runoff, slated for Sunday, Aras Publishing House Editor-in-Chief Rober Koptaล joins CivilNet to discuss what a victory for President Erdoฤan or the opposition will mean for the country. Koptaล also talks about what these elections have meant for Turkeyโs Kurds and Armenians, and whether the countryโs elites view the two minorities through a connected or a separate lens.

media:group.media:title: Post-Soviet Media: Money and Freedom
media:group.media:description:
Thomas Kent, the former President of Radio Free Europe, and Standards Editor at the Associated Press sat down with CivilNet to discuss the challenges facing independent media in Armenia and the region, including issues of funding and mass disinformation. Kent, who is a specialist in ethical journalism, and teaches at Columbia University, also explains how independent media outlets can better package and present content in 2023, in order to compete better with non-independent media outlets or with sources that do not observe a proper ethical code of conduct.

media:group.media:title: ิปีถีนีบีฅีฝ ึึีฏีฅีฌ ีฆีซีถีพีธึีซ ีฏีตีกีถึีจโค ีฅึีฏีธึ ีบีกีฟีฅึีกีฆีด ีกีถึีกีฎ ีขีชีทีฏีซ ีบีกีฟีดีธึีฉีตีธึีถีจ
media:group.media:description:
2020-ีซ ีฝีฅีบีฟีฅีดีขีฅึีซ 27-ีซีถ ีีกีตีฏีกีฆ ีีกึีธึีฉีตีธึีถีตีกีถีจ ีบีฅีฟึ ีง ีฃีถีกึ ยซีีธึึยป ีซีถึีฅีฏึีซีธีถ ีฐีซีพีกีถีคีกีถีธึีซ ีพีฅึีกีฏีฅีถีคีกีถีกึีดีกีถ ีขีกีชีกีถีดีธึีถึี ีฐีฅึีฉีกีบีกีฐีธึีฉีตีกีถ, ีฝีกีฏีกีตีถ ีีธึึีซ ึีธีญีกึีฅีถ ีฃีถีกึีฅีฌ ีง ิฑึึีกีญึ 28-ีกีดีตีก ีฅึีซีฟีกีฝีกึีคีจ ีกีดีขีธีฒีป ีบีกีฟีฅึีกีฆีดีซ ีจีถีฉีกึึีธึีด ีฅีฒีฅีฌ ีง ิฑึึีกีญีธึีดึ ีีซึีกีพีธึีธึีด ีง ีฝีฟีกึีฅีฌ ยซิตีฒีถีซีฏีถีฅึยป ีฏีธีนีพีธีฒ ีฟีฅีฒีกีดีกีฝีธึีด ีฐีธีฏีฟีฅีดีขีฅึีซ 30-ีซีถี ีขีธึีชีฏีฅีฟีซ ีฏีกีฐีกีพีธึีดีกีถ ีจีถีฉีกึึีธึีดึ ีีกีตีฏีกีฆีจ ิตึึีกีถีซ ีบีฅีฟีกีฏีกีถ ีขีชีทีฏีกีฏีกีถ ีฐีกีดีกีฌีฝีกึีกีถีซ ยซีึึีธีฌีธีฃีซีกยป ีขีกีชีกีถีดีธึีถึีธึีด ีฏีฌีซีถีซีฏีกีฏีกีถ ึ ึีคีซีถีกีฟีธึ ีง, ีกีทีญีกีฟีธึีด ีง ยซิฑึีดีฅีถีซีกยป ีฐีกีถึีกีบีฅีฟีกีฏีกีถ ีขีชีทีฏีกีฏีกีถ ีฏีฅีถีฟึีธีถีธึีดึ
